alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:33PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greensville, west central Sussex, south central Dinwiddie and east central Brunswick Counties through 400 PM EST... At 333 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Radium, or near Purdy, moving northeast at 30 mph. This storm has also been exhibiting weak rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Purdy around 345 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Cherry Hill and Callaville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for south central and southeastern Virginia.
